page.title: 02FARMING
page.content:
The lowland of the Conwy Valley is the most valuable in the area with rich pastures on lluvial and glacial soils. The land is used for mixed cattle and sheep grazing; fattening lambs and wintering yearlings whilst dairy cattle are also grazed. The Conwy Valley is in the rain shadow of Snowdonia and therefore has an attractive weather pattern.
